title: Friday evening shooting victim in stable condition
content:
A 17-year-old male victim is reportedly to be in stable condition after sustaining a gunshot wound Friday evening in northwest Santa Maria.
At about 5:54 p.m., Santa Maria Police officers were dispatched near the 600 block of South Lincoln to a report of a gunshot that was heard by neighbors in the area, said SMPD Lt. Jesse Silva.
Upon arrival, they located a 17-year-old male victim who sustained a non-life threatening gunshot wound to his torso. He was transported to Marian Regional Medical Center, then later airlifted to a Madera California trauma center.
Detectives along with crime scene technicians were also dispatched to the scene to collect any evidence that may be associated with the incident.
Officials determined that the shooting most likely took place in the alleyway in between Jones Street and South Lincoln.
The unknown suspect(s) fled prior to police arrival, according to officials.
The incident is currently under investigation by the Santa Maria Police Department. Anyone with information is encouraged to contact the SMPD at 805-928-3781.
